com.yantra.api.wms.inventory

Interface moveLocationInventory

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface moveLocationInventory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document moveLocationInventory(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      moveLocationInventory moves inventory in the system from a source location or LPN to a target location or LPN in the same node.

    • Method Detail

      • moveLocationInventory

        org.w3c.dom.Document moveLocationInventory(YFSEnvironment env,
                                           org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                           java.rmi.RemoteException

        moveLocationInventory moves inventory in the system from a source location or LPN to a target location or LPN in the same node.
        If location and LPN are not provided in the source, source locations are determined from the sequence of locations or zones configured for the adjustment reason code. The adjustment can only be negative. Also, the inventory adjustment happens for loose inventory only. For serial tracked items, the location of the serial is determined and used for adjustment.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSBeforeMoveLocationInventoryUE
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSGetFifoNumberUE

        Events Raised:

        Events raised during transaction CHANGE_GLOBAL_SERIAL

          LEFT_NODE:
            When serial inventory is moved to a location of a zone that doesn't track inventory, system assumes the inventory to be consumed and hence this event is raised from warehouse inventory management for each serial inventory movement.
            Data Published - INV_CHANGE_GLOBAL_SERIAL.LEFT_NODE.xml
          ON_CHANGE:
            When serial inventory is moved from a zone to a different zone that has inventory transitions defined and the supply type associated to target inventory status is different from the source inventory status, this event is raised from warehouse inventory management for each serial inventory movement.
            Data Published - INV_CHANGE_GLOBAL_SERIAL.ON_CHANGE.xml

        Audits:
        Two Audits are performed in YFS_LOCN_INVENTORY_AUDIT, one for source location with "-" operation for the quantity moved and another for the destination location with operation as "+". For inventory with serial numbers passed, audits are written for each serial number.

        Pre Conditions:
        A record must exist in database for the source information.

        Post Conditions: The quantity information in the YFS_INVENTORY_SUPPLY table is updated for items that are specified in the input XML file.

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        No Output XML.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
